DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this protocol is to determine whether Tacrolimus and Prednisolone are effective and safe in the treatment of the cyclophosphamide-resistant, refractory diffuse proliferative lupus nephritis
DOC.brief_title: A Pilot Study for the Efficacy and Safety of Tacrolimus in the Treatment of Refractory Lupus Nephritis
DOC.criteria: Biopsyproven lupus nephritis WHO Class IV , IV+V Previously treated by three times over of i.v. cyclophosphamide or 6 months more duration of immunosuppressive treatments (azathioprine, MMF, cyclophosphamide p.o.) for the lupus nephritis spot urine Protein creatinine raio > 1.0 RBC > 5 /HPF on microscopic examination of urine previous treatment of cyclosporine A or tacrolimus serum Creatinine lever : over 300 mmol/dl allergy to the macrolide antibiotics other systemic organ damage
